clinical_study.brief_title: Tablet-based Cognitive Behavioral Intervention for Older Adults With Arthritis Fatigue
clinical_study.official_title: Tablet-based Cognitive Behavioral Intervention: Comparison of Group vs. Individual CBT Education

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this project is to pilot test a long-term effect of Tab-G (tablet-based cognitive behavioral group education intervention). The investigators will evaluate the effect of Tab-G, relative to Tab-I (tablet-based cognitive behavioral individual education intervention) and usual care group, on (a) daily steps, (b) fatigue level, (c) self-efficacy and (d) quality of life.
Tab-G participants will receive 4 weekly CBT-based group education focusing on shared goal setting and mutual reinforcement in a group with 5 members. Tab-I participants will receive 4 weekly CBT-based education individually. The outcomes will be measured baseline, week 4 (intervention completion) and week 8 (follow-up). The investigators hypothesize that older adults receiving Tab-G will have greater improvements on outcomes compared to those receiving Tab-I or usual care at week 4, the intervention completion and at week 8 follow-up.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: The study uses an experimental pre- and post-test repeated measures design. Those satisfying the inclusion and exclusion criteria are randomly assigned to two interventions (Tab-I or Tab-G, n=20 each) or comparison group (n=20).

primary_outcome.description: daily step counts measured by an accelerometer

primary_outcome.measure: BRICS NINR PROMIS Fatigue Short Form 6a
primary_outcome.description: self-reported fatigue scale measuring both the experience of fatigue and the interference of fatigue on daily activities. Scores can range from 6 to 30, with higher scores indicating greater fatigue.

primary_outcome.measure: Self-Efficacy for Managing Chronic Disease 6-Item Scale
primary_outcome.description: self-reported self-efficacy scale. Scores can range from 6 to 60, with higher scores indicating higher self-efficacy.
self-reported perception of quality of life. Scores can range from 8 to 80 with higher scores indicating greater quality of life.

arm_group.description: Tab-G participants will receive 4 weekly CBT(cognitive behavioral therapy)-based group learning sessions to encourage a simple walking activity through videoconferencing meetings in a group of 5 members. The educational materials emphasize shared goal setting and mutual reinforcement.
Tab-I participants will receive 4 weekly CBT(cognitive behavioral therapy)-based individual learning sessions to encourage a simple walking activity through videoconferencing meetings.
A usual care group will receive general arthritis management education. Participant are instructed to maintain usual activity during the study period.

intervention.description: Participants receive a tablet preloaded with Tab-G application and an accelerometer.
Participants receive a tablet preloaded with Tab-I application and an accelerometer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. diagnosis of osteoarthritis or rheumatoid arthritis;
2. presence of greater than minimal fatigue scoring â‰¥13 (T-score>55) on the Patient Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) Short Form (SF) v1.0-Fatigue 6a; and
3. having Wi-Fi at home
Exclusion Criteria:
1. currently engaging in regular exercise;
2. non-ambulatory or presence of a condition that would limit the ability to walk (e.g., foot deformity, lower extremity joint surgery in past 6 months, stroke, severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease, etc.); and
3. delirium, dementia, or any conditions indicating deteriorating cognitive status as determined by the Mini-Cog.
